intro: Lomanthus yauyensis, commonly known as the Yauyé tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The tree is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It plays an important role in the ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
